verses.kjv: After these things Jesus walked in Galilee: for he would not walk in Jewry, because the Jews sought to kill him.
verses.ct: After this, Jesus traveled around Galilee. He deliberately avoided Judea because the Jewish leaders there were trying to kill him.

verses.kjv: Now the Jews’ feast of tabernacles was at hand.
verses.ct: The Jewish Festival of Shelters was approaching.

verses.kjv: His brethren therefore said unto him, Depart hence, and go into Judaea, that thy disciples also may see the works that thou doest.
verses.ct: So his brothers told him, "Leave here and go to Judea so your followers there can see the amazing things you're doing."

verses.kjv: For there is no man that doeth any thing in secret, and he himself seeketh to be known openly. If thou do these things, shew thyself to the world.
verses.ct: "Nobody who wants public recognition does things in secret. If you're really doing these things, show yourself to the world."

verses.kjv: For neither did his brethren believe in him.
verses.ct: Even his own brothers didn't believe in him.

verses.kjv: Then Jesus said unto them, My time is not yet come: but your time is alway ready.
verses.ct: Jesus responded, "The right moment hasn't arrived for me yet, but for you, any time works."

verses.kjv: The world cannot hate you; but me it hateth, because I testify of it, that the works thereof are evil.
verses.ct: "The world has no reason to hate you, but it hates me because I expose its actions as evil."

verses.kjv: Go ye up unto this feast: I go not up yet unto this feast: for my time is not yet full come.
verses.ct: "Go ahead to the festival. I'm not going yet, because my time hasn't fully come."

verses.kjv: When he had said these words unto them, he abode still in Galilee.
verses.ct: After saying this, he stayed behind in Galilee.

verses.kjv: But when his brethren were gone up, then went he also up unto the feast, not openly, but as it were in secret.
verses.ct: But after his brothers had left for the festival, he also went — not publicly, but quietly.

verses.kjv: Then the Jews sought him at the feast, and said, Where is he?
verses.ct: The Jewish leaders were looking for him at the festival, asking, "Where is that man?"

verses.kjv: And there was much murmuring among the people concerning him: for some said, He is a good man: others said, Nay; but he deceiveth the people.
verses.ct: There was widespread debate about him among the crowds. Some were saying, "He's a good man." Others argued, "No, he's misleading the people."

verses.kjv: Howbeit no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews.
verses.ct: Yet nobody talked about him openly, because they were afraid of the Jewish leaders.

verses.kjv: Now about the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple, and taught.
verses.ct: Halfway through the festival, Jesus went to the temple and began teaching.

verses.kjv: And the Jews marvelled, saying, How knoweth this man letters, having never learned?
verses.ct: The Jewish leaders were astonished, saying, "How does this man know so much without any formal education?"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered them, and said, My doctrine is not mine, but his that sent me.
verses.ct: Jesus answered them, "What I teach isn't my own — it comes from the one who sent me."

verses.kjv: If any man will do his will, he shall know of the doctrine, whether it be of God, or whether I speak of myself.
verses.ct: "Anyone who genuinely wants to do God's will can determine whether my teaching comes from God or whether I'm just speaking on my own authority."

verses.kjv: He that speaketh of himself seeketh his own glory: but he that seeketh his glory that sent him, the same is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.
verses.ct: "Someone who speaks on his own authority is looking for personal glory. But someone who seeks to honor the one who sent him — that person is genuine, and there is nothing false in him."

verses.kjv: Did not Moses give you the law, and yet none of you keepeth the law? Why go ye about to kill me?
verses.ct: "Didn't Moses give you the law? Yet not one of you actually follows it. So why are you trying to kill me?"

verses.kjv: The people answered and said, Thou hast a devil: who goeth about to kill thee?
verses.ct: The crowd responded, "You're demon-possessed! Who's trying to kill you?"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered and said unto them, I have done one work, and ye all marvel.
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "I performed one miracle, and all of you are shocked by it."

verses.kjv: Moses therefore gave unto you circumcision; (not because it is of Moses, but of the fathers;) and ye on the sabbath day circumcise a man.
verses.ct: "Moses gave you the practice of circumcision — though it actually originated with the patriarchs, not Moses — and you circumcise on the Sabbath."

verses.kjv: If a man on the sabbath day receive circumcision, that the law of Moses should not be broken; are ye angry at me, because I have made a man every whit whole on the sabbath day?
verses.ct: "If you circumcise a boy on the Sabbath to avoid breaking Moses' law, why are you furious with me for making a person completely well on the Sabbath?"

verses.kjv: Judge not according to the appearance, but judge righteous judgment.
verses.ct: "Stop judging by outward appearances and start making righteous judgments."

verses.kjv: Then said some of them of Jerusalem, Is not this he, whom they seek to kill?
verses.ct: Some of the people from Jerusalem started saying, "Isn't this the man they're trying to kill?"

verses.kjv: But, lo, he speaketh boldly, and they say nothing unto him. Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ?
verses.ct: "Look — he's speaking openly, and nobody is stopping him. Could the authorities have actually concluded that he is the Christ?"

verses.kjv: Howbeit we know this man whence he is: but when Christ cometh, no man knoweth whence he is.
verses.ct: "But we know where this man comes from. When the Christ appears, nobody is supposed to know where he's from."

verses.kjv: Then cried Jesus in the temple as he taught, saying, Ye both know me, and ye know whence I am: and I am not come of myself, but he that sent me is true, whom ye know not.
verses.ct: Then Jesus called out loudly while teaching in the temple, "Yes, you know me, and you know where I'm from. But I didn't come on my own initiative. The one who sent me is real, and you don't know him."

verses.kjv: But I know him: for I am from him, and he hath sent me.
verses.ct: "But I know him, because I come from him, and he is the one who sent me."

verses.kjv: Then they sought to take him: but no man laid hands on him, because his hour was not yet come.
verses.ct: At this, they tried to arrest him, but nobody could lay a hand on him because his time had not yet arrived.

verses.kjv: And many of the people believed on him, and said, When Christ cometh, will he do more miracles than these which this man hath done?
verses.ct: Still, many in the crowd put their faith in him, saying, "When the Christ comes, will he perform more miraculous signs than this man has?"

verses.kjv: The Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning him; and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take him.
verses.ct: The Pharisees heard the crowd whispering these things about him, so the chief priests and Pharisees sent temple guards to arrest him.

verses.kjv: Then said Jesus unto them, Yet a little while am I with you, and then I go unto him that sent me.
verses.ct: Jesus then said, "I'll only be with you a short time longer, and then I'm going back to the one who sent me."

verses.kjv: Ye shall seek me, and shall not find me: and where I am, thither ye cannot come.
verses.ct: "You will search for me but won't find me, and where I'm going, you cannot follow."

verses.kjv: Then said the Jews among themselves, Whither will he go, that we shall not find him? will he go unto the dispersed among the Gentiles, and teach the Gentiles?
verses.ct: The Jewish leaders said to each other, "Where does he plan to go that we won't be able to find him? Is he going to travel to the Jews scattered among the Greeks and teach the Greeks?"

verses.kjv: What manner of saying is this that he said, Ye shall seek me, and shall not find me: and where I am, thither ye cannot come?
verses.ct: "What did he mean when he said, 'You will search for me but won't find me,' and 'Where I'm going, you cannot follow'?"

verses.kjv: In the last day, that great day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried, saying, If any man thirst, let him come unto me, and drink.
verses.ct: On the last and most important day of the festival, Jesus stood up and called out, "If anyone is thirsty, come to me and drink!"

verses.kjv: He that believeth on me, as the scripture hath said, out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water.
verses.ct: "Whoever believes in me, just as Scripture has promised, rivers of living water will flow from within them."

verses.kjv: (But this spake he of the Spirit, which they that believe on him should receive: for the Holy Ghost was not yet given; because that Jesus was not yet glorified.)
verses.ct: (He was talking about the Holy Spirit, whom those who believed in him would later receive. The Spirit had not yet been given because Jesus had not yet been glorified.)

verses.kjv: Many of the people therefore, when they heard this saying, said, Of a truth this is the Prophet.
verses.ct: When many in the crowd heard these words, they said, "This really is the Prophet."

verses.kjv: Others said, This is the Christ. But some said, Shall Christ come out of Galilee?
verses.ct: Others declared, "This is the Christ!" But some objected, "The Christ can't come from Galilee, can he?"

verses.kjv: Hath not the scripture said, That Christ cometh of the seed of David, and out of the town of Bethlehem, where David was?
verses.ct: "Doesn't Scripture say that the Christ will be a descendant of David and come from Bethlehem, the town where David lived?"

verses.kjv: So there was a division among the people because of him.
verses.ct: So the crowd was divided over him.

verses.kjv: And some of them would have taken him; but no man laid hands on him.
verses.ct: Some wanted to arrest him, but still nobody laid a hand on him.

verses.kjv: Then came the officers to the chief priests and Pharisees; and they said unto them, Why have ye not brought him?
verses.ct: The temple guards returned to the chief priests and Pharisees, who demanded, "Why didn't you bring him in?"

verses.kjv: The officers answered, Never man spake like this man.
verses.ct: The guards answered, "No one has ever spoken the way this man speaks."

verses.kjv: Then answered them the Pharisees, Are ye also deceived?
verses.ct: The Pharisees shot back, "Have you been fooled too?"

verses.kjv: Have any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed on him?
verses.ct: "Has a single one of the rulers or Pharisees believed in him?"

verses.kjv: But this people who knoweth not the law are cursed.
verses.ct: "This crowd that doesn't understand the law — they're under a curse."

verses.kjv: Nicodemus saith unto them, (he that came to Jesus by night, being one of them,)
verses.ct: Nicodemus, who had previously visited Jesus at night and was one of their own group, spoke up:

verses.kjv: Doth our law judge any man, before it hear him, and know what he doeth?
verses.ct: "Does our law condemn anyone without first hearing from them and finding out what they've done?"

verses.kjv: They answered and said unto him, Art thou also of Galilee? Search, and look: for out of Galilee ariseth no prophet.
verses.ct: They fired back at him, "Are you from Galilee too? Investigate for yourself — no prophet comes from Galilee."

verses.kjv: And every man went unto his own house.
verses.ct: Then everyone went home.
